unnamed_cluster.Name: Clearance (Loose Running Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For wide commercial tolerances or allowances on external members

unnamed_cluster.Name: Clearance (Free Running Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: Not for use where accuracy is essential, but good for large temperature variations, high running speeds, or heavy journal pressures

unnamed_cluster.Name: Clearance (Close Running Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For running on accurate machines and for accurate location at moderate speeds and journal pressures

unnamed_cluster.Name: Clearance (Sliding Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: Where parts are not intended to run freely, but must move and turn freely and locate accurately

unnamed_cluster.Name: Clearance (Locational Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: Provides snug fit for location of stationary parts, but can be freely assembled and disassembled

unnamed_cluster.Name: Transition (Locational A)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For accurate location, a compromise between clearance and interference

unnamed_cluster.Name: Transition (Locational B)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For more accurate location where greater interference is permissible

unnamed_cluster.Name: Interference (Locational Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For parts requiring rigidity and alignment with prime accuracy of location but without special bore pressure requirements

unnamed_cluster.Name: Interference (Force Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: Suitable for parts that can be highly stressed or for shrink fits where the heavy pressing forces required are impractical

unnamed_cluster.Name: Interference (Medium Drive Fit)
unnamed_cluster.Description: For ordinary steel parts or shrink fits on light sections, the tightest fit usable with cast iron
